intro: Scrophularia aestivalis, commonly known as summer scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
